hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition on Consecutive Accumulation Days
hypothesis_content.statement: A NEUTRAL regime will transition to a BULL regime if, following a period of low volatility (20-day RV < 40%), BTC records two consecutive 'accumulation days'—where price closes in the top 33% of its daily range AND daily volume is greater than the 10-day moving average volume. A long entry on the close of the second such day will capture the initial breakout phase.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consecutive high-volume closes near the daily high, after a period of quiet, indicate sustained buying pressure overcoming overhead supply. This pattern suggests informed accumulation breaking the equilibrium of a neutral market, often preceding a momentum-driven regime shift as new buyers enter.
entry_conditions: Day 2: Conditions from Day 1 are met again (consecutive)
On Day 2, close above the 20-day simple moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches a 1:2 risk/reward ratio (target = entry + 2*(entry - stop_loss))
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below the low of the first accumulation day (Day 1)
exit_conditions.time_exit: Regime transitions to BULL (signal confirmed) or 7 days elapse

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% of such signals result in a regime transition to BULL within the subsequent 7-day window, or the average maximum favorable excursion for the trade does not significantly exceed the average maximum adverse excursion.
